item.title: Linda add a quote by Paul
item.description: "All things work together for good for those who are called according to His purpose." -- Paul

item.title: Linda add a quote by Desiderius Erasmus Roterodamus
item.description: "When I have a little money, I buy books; and if I have any left, I buy food and clothes." -- Desiderius Erasmus Roterodamus

item.title: Linda add a quote by Oscar Wilde
item.description: "Always forgive your enemies; nothing annoys them so much." -- Oscar Wilde

item.title: Linda add a quote by C.S. Lewis
item.description: "The stamp of the Saint is that he can waive his own rights and obey the Lord Jesus." -- C.S. Lewis

item.title: Linda add a quote by Anonymous
item.description: "I am the way the way the truth and the life, no one comes to the father but through me" -- Anonymous

item.title: Linda add a quote by Anonymous
item.description: "Rejoice in the Lord always. I will say it again Rejoice! Let your gentleness be evident to all. The Lord is near. Do not be anxious about anything, but in everything, by prayer and petition, with thanksgiving, present your requests to God. And the peace of God, which transcends all understanding, will guard your hearts and your minds in Christ Jesus." -- Anonymous

item.title: Linda add a quote by Anonymous
item.description: "I leave my peace with you. I give my peace to you. I do not give it to you as the world does. Do not let your hearts be troubled. And do not be afraid. John 14:27" -- Anonymous

item.title: Linda add a quote by John Newton
item.description: "This is faith: a renouncing of everything we are apt to call our own and relying wholly upon the blood, righteousness and intercession of Jesus." -- John Newton

item.title: Linda add a quote by Frank Zappa
item.description: "So many books, so little time." -- Frank Zappa

item.title: Linda add a quote by Jane Austen
item.description: "The person, be it gentleman or lady, who has not pleasure in a good novel, must be intolerably stupid." -- Jane Austen

item.title: Linda add a quote by Mother Teresa
item.description: "Do not wait for leaders; do it alone, person to person." -- Mother Teresa

item.title: Linda add a quote by Mother Teresa
item.description: "The person who gives with a smile is the best giver because God loves a cheerful giver." -- Mother Teresa

item.title: Linda add a quote by Joan Bauer
item.description: "My grandma always said that God made libraries so that people didn't have any excuse to be stupid." -- Joan Bauer

item.title: Linda add a quote by Harold Howe
item.description: "What a school thinks about its library is a measure of what it feels about education." -- Harold Howe

item.title: Linda add a quote by Stephanie Harvey
item.description: "Libraries should be the beating heart of the school, not mausoleums for dusty books." -- Stephanie Harvey

item.title: Linda add a quote by mark twain
item.description: "Reader, suppose you were an idiot. And suppose you were a member of Congress. But I repeat myself." -- mark twain

item.title: Linda add a quote by Ron Paul
item.description: "One thing is clear: The Founding Fathers never intended a nation where citizens would pay nearly half of everything they earn to the government." -- Ron Paul

item.title: Linda add a quote by C.S. Lewis
item.description: "I believe in Christianity as I believe that the sun has risen: not only because I see it, but because by it I see everything else." -- C.S. Lewis
